WEATHER FORECAST FOR SEA AREAS AROUND THE ISLAND DURING NEXT 24 HOURS
Issued at 12.00 noon on 29 August 2024.
A low-pressure area is likely to form over Northern Bay of Bengal today (29). Very strong
winds (70-80) kmph accompanied with heavy rainfalls and very rough seas are likely over
above sea areas. Naval and fishing communities in the above sea areas are requested to
be attentive to future forecasts issued by the Department of Meteorology in this regard.
Condition of Rain:
Showers may occur at times in the sea areas off the coast extending from  Puttalam  to Mathara
via  Colombo and Galle.
Winds:
Winds will be south-westerly in direction and wind speed will be (30-40) kmph.

ind speed can increase up to (55-60) kmph at times in the sea areas off the coasts extending from
Kankasanthurai to Chilaw via Mannar and Puttalam and from Hambantota to Pottuvil.
